onyomiExamples.meaning: buying books and not reading them, stockpiling books, tsundoku, books bought but not read
reading-book, reader, guidebook, manual, textbook (esp. a pre-war elementary school Japanese language textbook)
breaks and pauses (in a sentence), punctuation, way of reading (esp. kanbun)
Idu (archaic writing system that uses Chinese characters to represent the Korean language)

kunyomiExamples.meaning: to read, to count, to guess, to predict, to read (someone's thoughts), to see (e.g. into someone's heart), to divine
